fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Speaking of the billions of packets of crisps and savoury snacks sold annually, a feature said that Britons consume more crisps, crackers and nuts than everyone else in Europe put together. What it should have said is that – according to industry figures – we consume by tonnage more crisps, crackers and nuts than any other European country (Crunch time, 1 September, page 4, G2). • The late writer Italo Calvino was described as a Venetian. As a reader notes, he was born in Cuba and grew up in San Remo; he lived for some time in Paris (Castles in the air, 31 August, page 19, G2). • A pub acquired by chef Heston Blumenthal in Bray, Berkshire, is the Hinds Head. We called it the Golden Hind (Welcome to Hestonworld: villagers cry foul as chef adds third pub to Bray empire, 28 August, page 3). A paragraph about the new menu referred to bangna calda; that should have been bagna cauda. • The appliance maker Smeg was described in a commentary as a Swedish company. It is Italian (Tossing and yearning, 30 August, page 24).
